response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age (22)", "low", "At 22, the age is typical and does not itself strongly indicate high recidivism risk based on examples."),
    ("Gender (Male)", "low", "Being male is common in the sample and not a distinct differentiator on its own."),
    ("Race (White)", "low", "White individuals in the examples mostly had NO outcomes."),
    ("Arrests (3 times)", "medium", "Three arrests indicate a moderate level of criminal history. While not extreme, it is higher than those with a single arrest."),
    ("Conviction", "medium", "Having been convicted adds a risk element, though similar cases with conviction did not always recidivate."),
    ("Height/Weight (5'9\", 160 lbs)", "low", "These physical characteristics appear to have minimal impact in the provided examples."),
    ("Marital Status and Living Arrangement (Never married, living alone)", "medium", "Living alone and never being married often correlate with higher risk, though not definitive."),
    ("Education (High school diploma, not enrolled in college)", "low", "Being educated to high school level and not enrolled in college is common in non-recidivist cases."),
    ("Employment (3 jobs during the year)", "low", "Having multiple jobs suggests some stability which is seen in lower risk cases."),
    ("Drug Use (marijuana and cocaine in past four years)", "high", "Use of both marijuana and cocaine has been associated with higher recidivism in some examples."),
    ("Depression (Not felt depressed)", "low", "Lack of recent depression is generally a protective factor."),
    ("Family Background (Lived with both biological parents, household size 4, rural area)", "low", "A stable family background and rural upbringing are generally associated with lower risk."),
    ("Spiritual Belief (Believes God has something to do with his personal fate)", "low", "This belief has been correlated with lower risk outcomes in several examples.")
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 22, the age is typical and does not itself strongly indicate high recidivism risk based on examples.
Being male is common in the sample and not a distinct differentiator on its own.
White individuals in the examples mostly had NO outcomes.
Three arrests indicate a moderate level of criminal history. While not extreme, it is higher than those with a single arrest.
Having been convicted adds a risk element, though similar cases with conviction did not always recidivate.
These physical characteristics appear to have minimal impact in the provided examples.
Marital Status and Living Arrangement (Never married, living alone)
Living alone and never being married often correlate with higher risk, though not definitive.
Education (High school diploma, not enrolled in college)
Being educated to high school level and not enrolled in college is common in non-recidivist cases.
Having multiple jobs suggests some stability which is seen in lower risk cases.
Drug Use (marijuana and cocaine in past four years)
Use of both marijuana and cocaine has been associated with higher recidivism in some examples.
Lack of recent depression is generally a protective factor.
Family Background (Lived with both biological parents, household size 4, rural area)
A stable family background and rural upbringing are generally associated with lower risk.
Spiritual Belief (Believes God has something to do with his personal fate)
This belief has been correlated with lower risk outcomes in several examples.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. First,analyze the following example cases of risk factors and resulting 3 year rearrest recidivism outcome:

Example #1:
Risk Factors: The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 240 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 4. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.
Outcome: NO

Example #2:
Risk Factors: The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs between 150 and 174 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.
Outcome: NO

Next, step back and take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism for this case:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 3 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs 160 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 4, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

Respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
